popup.arrows.body: A distinctive circular arrows pattern is apparent from the top view of the diamond’s crown. Created by the play of light as it enters and exits the diamond, the arrows pattern indicates superior optical symmetry and a higher cut grade.
popup.arrows.title: Arrows
popup.brilliance.body: Brilliance is a measure of the intense white light that radiates from the stone. Brilliance is created by the diamond's unique cut, which determines how the light that enters the diamond is reflected back to the viewer.
popup.brilliance.title: Brilliance
popup.carat.body: Carat is the measure of a diamond’s mass or weight. For the past century, the carat unit has been set at a standard 200 milligrams. Diamonds are often measured in increments of 1/4 carat.
popup.carat.title: Carat
popup.clarity.body: Clarity is the measure of a diamond’s inclusions, which occur naturally inside the stone or on the stone's surface. Flawless diamonds are considered the most desirable for their rare perfection.
popup.clarity.title: Clarity
popup.color.body: Color is the measure of a diamond’s natural hue. The grading spectrum ranges from colorless to yellow. Colorless diamonds are rare, and are prized for their natural beauty and value.
popup.color.title: Color
popup.cut.body: Cut is the measure of a diamond’s beauty and craftsmanship. A diamond's cut grade is determined by its geometrical proportions and symmetry, which affect the play of light reflected in the diamond.
popup.cut.title: Cut
popup.cut_symmery.body: Cut grade is determined by the quality of the diamond's craftsmanship. In the hands of the professional cutter, the rough stone is transformed into a polished diamond featuring optimal proportion, symmetry and light refraction. The cut is the diamond's unique signature, reflecting its individual character and beauty.
popup.cut_symmery.title: Cut & Craftsmanship
popup.cut_symmery3d.body: Cut grade is determined by the quality of the diamond's craftsmanship. In the hands of the professional cutter, the rough stone is transformed into a polished diamond featuring optimal proportion, symmetry and light refraction. The cut is the diamond's unique signature, reflecting its individual character and beauty.
popup.cut_symmery3d.title: Cut and Symmentry Grading
popup.fire.body: When light enters and exits the dense structure of the diamond, it refracts, or bends. This refraction radiates vivid flares of rainbow colors that are commonly described as the diamond's 'fire'. Diamonds with intense fire are appreciated for their fascinating play of color and beauty at different angles.
popup.fire.title: Fire
popup.hearts.body: A distinctive circular hearts pattern is apparent from the bottom view of the diamond’s pavilion. Created by the play of light as it enters and exits the diamond, the hearts pattern indicates superior optical symmetry and a higher cut grade.
popup.hearts.title: Hearts
popup.inscription.body: View your diamond like a professional. In this view your diamond has been magnified similar to how your diamond is graded in a lab. This will allow you to see the fingerprint of the diamond that most people never experience.
popup.inscription.title: ID Inscription
popup.light.body: As light enters and exits a diamond, the rare allure of the unique gemstone is revealed. Light performance is the combined grading of the four light qualities that define the diamond's individual beauty: Brilliance, Sparkle, Fire and Light Symmetry.
popup.light.title: Light Performance Results
popup.loupe3d.body: The Sarine Loupe knits together thousands of individual images to present an accurate, instant picture of the diamond's cut and clarity. Intuitive 3D imaging allows you to explore the diamond at near microscopic level, for a superbly precise viewing experience.
popup.loupe3d.title: Diamond Imaging
popup.loupe.body: The Sarine Loupe provides advanced virtual imaging of the diamond's top view, based on its unique cut and clarity. See an instant, accurate display of the diamond's actual appearance.
popup.loupe.title: Diamond Imaging
popup.realview.body: In Real View mode, the diamond is displayed as it will look in a room lighting setting, offering a sense of the diamond's appearance and character in real life. The tilting feature creates an accurate, dynamic view of the diamond's overall look from multiple angles.
popup.realview.title: Real View
popup.report.body: The report contains information about a diamond's ID Number, Shape, Color, Clarity and more. Use this report to gain a better understanding of a diamond's properties, based on a laboratory analysis.
popup.report.title: GSI Report
popup.scintillation.body: As a diamond moves, the play of light inside the stone creates dramatic, luminous flashes that are ever changing in their beauty. The diamond's scintillation reflects the quality of the cut, a direct result of the skill and craftsmanship of the professional diamond cutter.
popup.scintillation.title: Scintillation
popup.sparkle.body: As a diamond moves, the play of light inside the stone creates dramatic, luminous flashes that are ever changing in their beauty. The diamond's sparkle reflects the quality of the cut, a direct result of the skill and craftsmanship of the professional diamond cutter.
popup.sparkle.title: Sparkle
popup.symmetry.body: Light symmetry is determined by the quality of a diamond's cut and the position of inclusions and blemishes, which may occur during the natural formation process. A well-cut diamond features optimal proportions for equal light distribution.
popup.symmetry.title: Symmetry
popup.thumbnail_menu.title: Diamond Story
popup.aboutUs.title: About Us

slide.aboutUs.text: To be the world leader in the provision of technological solutions for the diamond and gemstone industries, with innovative and advanced products and services for the benefit of the entire industry, from mine to consumers.

slide.cut.title: Cut & Craftsmanship
slide.cut3d.body: View the accurate geometrical measurements of the diamond to evaluate the proportions.
slide.cut3d.title: Cut and Symmentry Grading
slide.hna.body: Hearts & Arrows is a symmetrical optical pattern that is visible in brilliant diamonds cuts to the highest quality and precision.

popup.externalImage.title: AGS ASET
popup.externalImage.body:
Angular Spectrum Evaluation Tool® (ASET) was developed to demonstrate - in red, green, and blue - how the diamond is performing - in other words, how the diamond is handling and returning light to our eyes.
Red indicates the brightest areas of the diamond - areas that attract the brightest light from above.
Green also indicates light return; however, from an indirect source which is not as bright.
The blue indicates a contrast pattern of dark reflections giving the diamond its personality.
slide.externalImage.title: AGS Report
slide.externalImage.body:
AGSL Computer generated light performance map for this diamond.
U.S Patent No: 7.355.683
